https://doi.org/10.7927/0rvr-4538.Description: The Daily and Annual PM2.5 Concentrations for the Contiguous United States 1-km Grids dataset provides daily and annual PM2.5 concentration data in the US. These data may be useful in public health research to estimate short and long-term effects on human health.
https://doi.org/10.7927/0rvr-4538.Project: LANCE - Land, Atmosphere Near real-time Capability for EOS, SEDAC - Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center

https://doi.org/10.7927/a4mb-4t86.Description: The Daily 8-Hour Maximum and Annual O3 Concentrations for the Contiguous United States, 1-km Grids, v1 (2000 - 2016) dataset provides daily 8-hour maximum and annual ground-level Ozone (O3) concentration data in the US. These data may be useful in air quality research and public health research.

https://doi.org/10.7927/weq9-pv30.Description: The Global Pesticide Grids (PESTCHEMGRIDS) dataset provides a global gridded dataset of commonly-used agricultural pesticides. These data may be useful in assessing human and ecosystem exposure to potential toxicants, environmental modeling, agricultural chemical contamination, risk analysis, and related research at the global, regional, national, and local levels.

https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The Earthdata Search Disaster Dashboard is a collection of near real-time imagery and data products from NASA and other agencies that may be useful for monitoring, responding to, and researching natural and man-made disasters. The dashboard is a subset of the larger Earthdata Search collection.

The Earthdata Web Worldview tool allows the user to interactively browse global satellite imagery within hours of being acquired. The Worldview tool from NASA's Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS) provides the capability to interactively browse over 600 global, full-resolution satellite imagery layers and then download the underlying data.

The Earthdata Search Disaster Dashboard is a collection of near real-time imagery and data products from NASA and other agencies that may be useful for monitoring, responding to, and researching natural and man-made disasters. The dashboard is a subset of the larger Earthdata Search collection.

The Earthdata Search Disaster Dashboard is a collection of near real-time imagery and data products from NASA and other agencies that may be useful in monitoring, preparing for, and responding to natural disasters such as hurricanes, flooding, and wildfires. The dashboard is a customized search interface within Earthdata Search that allows users to search, discover, visualize, and access data from multiple datasets in support of disaster research and response.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/Aura/OMI/DATA.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides daily global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements. Carbon monoxide is a pollutant that can have harmful effects on human health, including reducing the amount of oxygen that can be transported in the bloodstream to critical organs like the heart and brain.

https://aeronet.gsfc.nasa.gov/cgi-bin/dr.Description: The AERONET (AErosol RObotic NETwork) database provides ground-based observations of aerosol optical depth (AOD), a measure of the amount of aerosols in the atmosphere. These data may be useful in air quality research and monitoring.

https://so2.gsfc.nasa.gov/.Description: The Global Sulfur Dioxide Monitoring dataset provides information on sulfur dioxide in the air. Sulfur dioxide can affect air quality and the health of residents in an area. These data may aid in air quality research.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5270/S5P-hcp1l2m.Description: The Sentinel-5 Precursor (S5P) Tropospheric Ozone dataset provides data on tropospheric ozone. Ozone in the troposphere can affect air quality and human health. The dataset includes data for the current year.

https://search.earthdata.nasa.gov/search.Description: The Earthdata Search Disaster Dashboard is a collection of near real-time imagery and data products from NASA and other agencies that may be useful in monitoring, preparing for, and responding to natural disasters such as hurricanes, flooding, and wildfires. The dashboard is a customized search interface within Earthdata Search that allows users to search, discover, visualize, and access data from multiple datasets in support of disaster research and response.

http://www.tropomi.eu/data-products/uv-a.Description: The TROPOMI (TROPOspheric Monitoring Instrument) is a space-borne spectrometer that measures air pollution and greenhouse gases. The TROPOMI instrument is part of the European Space Agency's (ESA) Sentinel-5 Precursor satellite. The TROPOMI NO2 (Nitrogen Dioxide) dataset shows the average concentration of NO2 in the atmosphere. High levels of NO2 can cause respiratory problems and other health issues.

https://doi.org/10.5067/40L92G8144IV.Description: The MOPITT (Measurements of Pollution in the Troposphere) dataset provides daily global carbon monoxide (CO) measurements. Carbon monoxide is a pollutant that can have harmful effects on human health, including reducing the amount of oxygen that can be transported in the bloodstream to critical organs like the heart and brain.

https://doi.org/10.5067/VIIRS/AERDB_L2_V.Description: The VIIRS Aerosol NRT product from NASA's Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite (VIIRS) uses the DB (Deep Blue) algorithm over land and the SOAR (Satellite Ocean Aerosol Retrieval) algorithm over water to determine atmospheric aerosol loading for daytime, cloud-free, snow-free scenes. This data product is designed to facilitate continuity in the aerosol record provided by the VIIRS (Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite) aerosol project for other sensors, including the Sea-viewing Wide Field-of-view Sensor (SeaWiFS) and Terra/Aqua Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometers (MODIS). The VIIRS Aerosol NRT product is a Level-2 product, generated at 6 km, at nadir spatial resolution. The DB and SOAR algorithms use combinations of VIIRS's reflective solar bands to provide information about the loading and size/type of aerosol particles in the atmosphere. Radiometrically-accurate radiances are required, as are cloud-free, snow-free daytime scenes; thus, gaps in the aerosol data will appear wherever these conditions are not met.

https://worldview.earthdata.nasa.gov/?v=.Description: The Hazard Mapper layer on NASA Worldview provides a collection of near real-time natural and man-made disaster data and satellite imagery. These data are useful for monitoring natural and man-made disasters, including tropical storms, wildfires, and air quality.

https://dx.doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MYD14.0.Description: The Aqua Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) Thermal Anomalies and Fire (MYD14) product identifies fires and other thermal anomalies such as volcanoes. These data may aid in air quality research.
